column1: Hebi (simplified Chinese: 鹤壁; traditional Chinese: 鶴壁; pinyin: Hèbì [xɤ̂.pî]; postal: Hopi) is a prefecture-level city in northern Henan province
column2: China. Situated in mountainous terrain at the edge of the Shanxi plateau
column3: Hebi is about 25 miles (40 km) south of Anyang
column4: 40 miles (64 km) northeast of Xinxiang and 65 miles (105 km) north of Kaifeng.

column1: Hebi has several coal mines. The city is also home to Hebi New Area
The prefecture-level city of Hebi administers 3 districts and 2 counties.
